gurmukhi: krYN qIr mwrM ] bhYN loh pwrM ]22]99]
transliteration: Darain Toor Maaran|| Bahain Loh Dhaaran||22||99||
translation: They are showering the arrows and striking the sharp steel-arms.22.99.

gurmukhi: ndI sRox pUrM ] iPrI gYx hUrM ]
transliteration: Nadoo Sron Pooran|| Phiroo Gadn Hooran||
translation: The stream of blood has become full and the houris are roaming in the sky.
The goddess Kali is roaring in the firmament and the female demon of the begging bowl is laughing.23.100.

gurmukhi: khUM bwj mwry ] khUM sUr Bwry ]
transliteration: Kahoon Baaj Mdare|| Kahoon Soor Bhdare||
translation: Somewhere there are dead horses and somewhere the fallen mighty warriors.

gurmukhi: khUM crm tUty ] iPry g`j PUty ]24]101]
transliteration: Kahoon Charam Toote|| Phire Gadj Phoote||24||101||
translation: Somewhere there are broken shields and somewhere the wounded elephants are roaming.24.101.

gurmukhi: khUM brm byDy ] khUM crm Cydy ]
transliteration: Kahoon Baram Bedhe|| Kahoon Charam Chhede||
translation: Somewhere the armour is penetrated and the inflicted skein is being seen.

gurmukhi: khUM pIl prmM ] kty bwj brmM ]25]102]
transliteration: Kahoon Pool Paramannd|| Kate Baaj Baramannd||25||102||
translation: Somewhere there are chopped elephants and somewhere the saddles of horses are seen cut down.25.102.

gurmukhi: blI bYr ru`Jy ] smuh swr Ju`Jy ]
transliteration: Badoo Bair Rujjhe|| Samuh Saar Jhujjhe||
translation: The brave warriors are engaged in inimical acts, all of them are fightning with their weapons.

gurmukhi: lKy bIr KyqM ] ncy BUq pRyqM ]26]103]
transliteration: Lakhe Boor Khetan|| Nache Bhoot Pretan||26||103||
translation: Realising the presence of warriors in the battlefield, the ghosts and evil spirits are dancing.26.103.
The meat-eaters are dancing, those who roam in the sky, are laughing.
The crows are cawing and the elegant warriors are intoxicated.27.104.
The wears of canopies are full of fury and from their bows shoot their arrows.

gurmukhi: auTy iC`C ie`CM ] cly qIr iq`CM ]28]105]
transliteration: Outhe Chhichchh Ichchhan|| Chale Toor Tichchhan||28||105||
translation: They are desirous of their victory and thus are shooting their sharp shafts.28.105.
Ganas, Gandharvas, spies, minstrels and the Siddhas with miraculous powers.
